item.title: Road t5raffic signs fallen over, 21st April
item.description:
There have been 'temporary' road traffic signs on a fairly long section of the A40, from Charlton Kings to near the Dowdeswell Reservoir, for years. They have been falling over and now only 1 is still standing. Currently cars approaching Cheltenham can legitimately travel at 60mph until they reach Charlton Kings. Traffic leaving Charlton Kings has one sign telling it to travel at 40mph then there is no end of speed restriction sign at all .Please re-erect and secure the temporary speed signs, make them permanent or finally remove them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Coxhorne Cottage London Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very poor road surface, 20th April
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham

item.title: Footpath with trees hanging down, 19th April
item.description:
On the footpath between Pirton Lane and the Winston Road overpass, a tree is overgrown and is obstructing the path. Can the council contact the appropriate land owner to have it cut back or cut it back?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 107 Pirton Lane, Churchdown

item.title: Broken traffic lights, 18th April
item.description:
Traffic lights at this location are not working. I can see no justification for having lights at this location on a weekend. There are weekday works on going on the pavement but these are not providing any hazard for pedestrians or wheel chairs. Why have highways permitted this set of temporary traffic signals to be installed just 200m from the next ones outside the local co op for n the same road? These lights are a hazard in themselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 94 Parton Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet
